Divine Conduit.Title: Divine Conduit
Divine Conduit.Description: Adherents channel spells from a Divine source. Their Spellcasting Bonus is Will+Enigmas, they use a holy symbol as a Foci, and do not need a free hand to cast spells.  They have access to a number of spells as their Aptitude+Knowledge to a minimum of one and two Cantrips. As a Downtime Action they can pray to be granted a different selection of Tier 1 spells. They have a base Burn of 6 that resets after a Long Rest.

Domain Arcana.Title: Arcana Domain
Domain Arcana.Description: Adherents also have specific spells granted to them by their divinity. Every divinity has one or more domains that they have dominion over. Adherents channel their power through one of their divinity's Domains. The Adherent always has the Domain spell prepared and they don't count against the Adherent's list of prepared spells.

Rage.Title: Rage
Rage.Description: Berserkers have a base Burn of 6 and can fly into a rage with Interaction by making Fortitude+Focus against their current Burn. If they took damage last round they have an Edge on the roll. When they rage, increase their Burn by one. While in a Rage the Berserker adds their Fortitude to damage, has Damage Resistance, and does not go Unconscious when reduced to 0 HP but are Dying. The Rage lasts until they do not roll against an enemy by the end of their turn or they decide to end it.

Interaction.Description: While in a Rage the Berserker adds their Fortitude to damage, has Damage Resistance, and does not go Unconscious when reduced to 0 HP but are Dying.

Fearsome.Title: Fearsome
Fearsome.Description: With a Maneuver the Berserker can intimidate someone within a 6 space Range with a Fortitude+Social roll verses the target's Mind defense to make themÂ Frightened until the end of their next turn.

Maneuver.Description: Frighten target until the end of their next round

Channel Oath.Title: Channel Oath
Channel Oath.Description: Dedicant channel the power of their oath to shape the world. Their Spellcasting Bonus is Will+Focus, they can use their weapon as a Foci (or a holy symbol if their oath is religious), and do not need a free hand to cast spells. They know as many Tier 1 spells as their Will+Focus to a minimum of one. Their Fervor resets to 0 that resets after a Short Rest. To cast a spell they need to spend the spell's Tier times 2 worth of Fervor.

Rebuke.Title: Rebuke
Rebuke.Description: As a Response make a Weapon attack against a foe that attacks an ally that Exposes the target.

Response.Description: Make a Weapon attack against a foe that attacks and ally. Expose the target

Rising Fervor.Title: Rising Fervor
Rising Fervor.Description: The Dedicant gains Fervor each time the Dedicant Exploits a foe

Smite.Title: Smite
Smite.Description: As an Interaction, the Dedicant can spend 1 Fervor to do an additional 1d8 damage on the previous weapon attack.

Slippery.Title: Slippery
Slippery.Description: As a Maneuver a Rogue can Evade and move their Stride speed.

Stealthy.Title: Stealthy
Stealthy.Description: As a Maneuver a Rogue can Hide and move their Stride speed.

Sneak Attack.Title: Sneak Attack 2d6
Sneak Attack.Description: As an Action, Exploit a foe by making a Weapons Roll to deal weapon damage and an additional 2d6.

Foebinding.Title: Foebinding
Foebinding.Description: As an Maneuver a Scout can designate a foe. As long as they make no attacks against other foes or make responses to other foes, the next round they have an additional 1d4 on Weapons and Senses rolls against that foe.

Wildswalker.Title: Wildswalker
Wildswalker.Description: A Scout can move through Difficult Terrain and Hazardous Terrain without a penalty to their speed and can move at full speed while hidden.

Wildcrafting.Title: Wildcrafting
Wildcrafting.Description: A Scout has Expertise in tracking, hunting, navigating, and wilderness survival.

Battle Recovery.Title: Battle Recovery
Battle Recovery.Description: When taking a Short or Long Rest, Warriors gain 1d8 plus their Fortitude worth of Temporary HP.

Combat Maneuver.Title: Combat Maneuver
Combat Maneuver.Description: As an Action a Warrior can make a Weapons Roll on an Exposed foe. The warrior has an Edge on that attack.

Martial Training.Title: Martial Training
Martial Training.Description: As a Perk for all weapons the Warrior can deal max damage.

Primal Channel.Title: Primal Channel
Primal Channel.Description: Spells are revealed to Wildshapers through their connection with the primal forces of nature. Their Spellcasting Bonus is Will+Knowledge and use a Wildshaper Foci or Apothecary Pouch as a Foci. They know as many Tier 1 spells as their Wits+Knowledge and two Cantrips. During a Long Rest they can commune with nature and change the spells they know. They have a starting Burn of 6 that resets after a Long Rest.

Wildshape.Title: Wildshape
Wildshape.Description: As a Maneuver a Wildshaper can roll against their Burn to polymorph into one of two Beasts of Challenge 2 or lower that the Wildeshaper knows. Communing with nature as a Downtime action they can change what beasts they can polymorph into. They gain the beast's HP inTemporary HP along with its Strength, Fortitude, and Dexterity bonuses. Their Defenses, Deflect and Soak are derived from these new bonuses. When the Wild Shaped Wildshaper's  Temporary HP is reduced to 0 they revert to their natural form and take any additional damage left over from the attack. Wildshaping increases their Burn by 2. The Wildshaper has two shapes they can wildshape into.

Arcane Initiate.Title: Arcane Initiate
Arcane Initiate.Description: Wizards channel the arcane energies that flow through the world. Their Spellcasting Bonus is their Aptitude+Enigmas and they use an Arcane Foci or Spell Component Pouch as their Foci. After each Long Rest they decide what spells to prepare for the following day, up to their Aptitude+Knowledge to a minimum of one and two Cantrips. Wearing armor casting causes Hindrance on Enigma rolls. They have a starting Burn of 6 that resets after a Long Rest.

Ritual Cast.Title: Ritual Cast
Ritual Cast.Description: The wizard can cast any spell from their spellbook as a Ritual.

Spellbook.Title: Spellbook
Spellbook.Description: The Wizard records all the spells they know in their Spellbook. They start with two Cantrips and as many Tier 1 spells as their Aptitude+Arcana. They can scribe a new spell from a scroll or other Spellbook into their Spellbook with an Aptitude+Enigma roll. Scribing takes one hour per Spell Tier. The spell takes up two pages per Spell Tier of the spell in the Spellbook. If the Roll fails, the pages the spell would have taken up are ruined. When copying from a Spellbook the character wrote the spell in, they have an Edge to copy it.
